### About me


I am a postdoctoral researcher in the [PreMeDICaL Inria-Inserm](https://team.inria.fr/premedical/) team with [Julie Josse](http://juliejosse.com). My current research focuses on missing data and synthetic data generation. Previously, I completed my PhD in Applied Mathematics at [Inria](https://inria.fr/fr) and [Université Côte d'Azur](https://univ-cotedazur.fr), under the supervision of [Charles Bouveyron](https://math.univ-cotedazur.fr/~cbouveyr/) and [Marco Corneli](https://math.univ-cotedazur.fr/~mcorneli/), funded by the [3IA](https://3ia.univ-cotedazur.eu). During my PhD, my research primarily focused model-based clustering methods for dynamic bipartite networks, with applications in pharmacovigilance. 

My research interests include:

 - Network analysis: stochastic block models (SBM), latent block model (LBM)
 - Clustering: model-based clustering, mixture models
 - Missing data: imputation methods, synthetic data generation
 - Applications in medicine
 - Heterogeneous data
 - Time series analysis
